description: As of Apr. 1, Uzbekistan introduces a self-isolation, seniors older than 65 not allowed to leave home, except for going to nearby shops, pharmacies.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Uzbekistan makes self-isolation regime mandatory in Tashkent, Nukus, as well as regional centers as of Apr. 6:
"Citizens are strictly forbidden to go out unless absolutely necessary, except for food, medicine, a doctor's visit, and travel to work.
- The movement of motorcycles and bicycles is limited
- Citizens of advanced age, in particular, over 65 years of age and having chronic diseases are strictly prohibited from leaving home without emergency
- Citizens with fever will not be allowed in large food markets and supermarkets
- It is forbidden to gather on the streets in groups of more than 3 people. 2 meters social distance required
- It is forbidden to move without personal protective equipment (masks)
- It is forbidden to hold weddings and other celebrations".
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Uzbekistan: Due to coronavirus Namangan introduces nine days weekend from Mar. 28 to Apr. 5, residents instructed not to go out unless absolutely necessary. UPDATE: The original lockdown in the region imposed on March 28 obliging citizens to not leave their place of residence unless in extreme situation till April 5 has been annulled and now, starting from April 13, in Namangan and Uchqo'rg'on Districts of Namangan Region, residents are obliged to go out only once a day to shops, markets, pharmacies located not over 100 metres from home. Violators will be issued hefty fines.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Uzbekistan: Due to coronavirus Namangan introduces nine days weekend from Mar. 28 to Apr. 5, residents instructed not to go out unless absolutely necessary. UPDATE: Uzbekistan relaxes its lockdown measures and starting from April 30:

- "it is allowed to use personal and service cars with passengers, as well as bicycles and motor vehicles for trips to and from work, as well as for the purchase of goods essentials, medicines, medical products and food."

- "Citizens are allowed to take walks in the immediate vicinity of high-rise buildings and in courtyards with the condition of wearing masks and maintaining social distance. At the same time, children under the age of 14 must take walks accompanied by adults."

description: On February 3, The President of Uzbekistan signed a decree on the creation of a special republican commission to prepare a program of measures to prevent the importation and spread of a new type of coronavirus in Uzbekistan. The commission was headed by Prime Minister Abdulla Aripov. A special republican commission was created under the leadership of Abdulla Aripov. The commission’s tasks include continuous analysis and monitoring of the global, regional and country epidemiological conditions, forecasting the trends in the spread and possible worsening of the epidemiological situation of coronavirus in the country.

type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Uzbekistan may provide parental leave during quarantine in kindergartens

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 17, “Starting from 18 March, teachers will go on paid leave. The work that they had to carry out during the holidays from 21 to 28 March, they will do remotely," the Minister of Public Education Sherzod Shermatov said. School principals, their deputies, managers, psychologists, janitors and caretakers will continue to work in schools. The length of the holidays for schoolchildren will depend on the situation, Shermatov said.
type_text: All school teachers in Uzbekistan go on paid leave as of Mar. 18
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: "Visa validity period of foreign citizens staying in Uzbekistan will be automatically extended until April 10, 2020," was announced on March 17.

description: The interval between bus arrivals increased in Tashkent, Uzbekistan as of Mar. 19 due to a decrease in public demand.

description:
Uzbekistan: Special Republican Commission on Prevention of the Covid-19 Spread approves the following measures:
"Transaction fees will not be charged on plastic cards of pensioners.

The validity period of all expired documents (licenses, permits, passports, residence permits, rights, car insurance, inspection) is automatically extended until 1 July 2020.

Private clinics will be able to provide paid coronavirus testing services until 1 September 2020.

It is allowed to trade in non-food products (clothing, household goods) through mobile points.

Until 10 May, new taxi licenses will not be issued. Taxi drivers will be required to wear special clothing (overalls, masks and gloves) in the car.

Visas to all foreign nationals are automatically renewed until 1 June 2020."
type_text: Uzbekistan: Special Republican Commission on Prevention of the Covid-19 Spread approves new measures
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On Apr. 23, Uzbek President adopted a resolution “On measures to attract external assistance to support the population, budget, basic infrastructure and business entities during the coronavirus epidemic”, which outlines a roadmap for attracting grants and concessional long-term financing for measures to counteract the negative consequences of the global COVID-19 pandemic.
type_text: Measures to attract grants to combat the negative consequences of COVID-19 are identified

description: Uzbek President signs another decree “On additional measures to support the population and businesses during the coronavirus pandemic” on Apr. 27, which outlines tax deduction for charities from April 1 to October 1, tax exemptions on certain services, as well as other alleviation measures.
type_text: President signs a decree on additional measures to support the population and businesses during the coronavirus pandemic

description: Uzbekistan temporarily suspends the export of raw materials for the production of medical products and the import of cement products from May 1 to December 31, 2020 in response to the economic consequences of a pandemic.
type_text: Uzbekistan temporarily suspends the export of raw materials for the production of medical products and the import of cement products

description: On May 8, Uzbekistan dispatches specialists with extensive experience and qualifications in the field of combating COVID-19 and effective treatment of patients to Tajikistan.

description: Students in Uzbekistan "conduct dictations on the topic of coronavirus infection" in order to "convey information to children about how to protect themselves from the disease," as reported on Feb. 5.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: "Uzbekistan's Health Ministry on [March 4] began warning people about coronavirus by sending text messages about ways of protection."
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
On 15 March, a call center for coronavirus infection began to operate under the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Uzbekistan.

According to the press secretary of the Tashkent Pediatric Medical Institute Khasanhodja Obidov, over the past day, he received about 20 thousand requests from the population asking for information on how this infection spreads and how to resist it.

The call center employs more than 200 healthcare professionals who provide competent information. Call center is working around the clock. You can contact him by short number 1003.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On Mar. 15, the Uzbek Health Ministry sets up call center to answer coronavirus-related questions.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: In Uzbekistan "The Central Bank recommended to minimize visits to banks for making current payments and to use remote payment methods instead, such as Internet banking, mobile applications of banks and payment systems," on March 18.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 20, The Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan created an official website http://coronavirus.uz, where users can get all the necessary information about coronavirus infection.
In particular, it refers to the epidemic situation in Uzbekistan, daily operational data, and the latest news from reliable sources. The users can also find contact details of the headquarters of the regional health departments, the operational headquarters of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the embassies of our country in foreign countries. And useful information and recommendations on how to protect the usersrself and protect the usersrself from COVID-19 helps to increase public awareness. Also on the site the users can find a list of reliable sources of information.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uzbek National Chamber of Innovative Healthcare launched a telegram channel “National Chamber COVID-19” (https://t.me/uzhealth_covid2019) to collect requests from health professionals who want to help fight coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 2, The Ministry of Health of Republic of Uzbekistan announced the development and launch of an online telegram of a consultant bot together with Unified Integrator UZINFOCOM LLC to provide medically sound answers to citizens' questions. On the site, people can see the map, which shows in which regions confirmation of coronavirus infection is recorded. Secondly, under this card there is a button “Epidemiological route of patients with confirmed coronavirus infection COVID-19”. By clicking on it, people can trace in what places the patients managed to visit before arriving at the hospital. Having received this information, be careful not to visit these places
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: According to news on April 11, The Ministry of Health, in collaboration with the World Health Organization, has prepared the “National COVID-19 Guide”, which describes the necessary measures to combat coronavirus infection.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On February 7, it was announced that citizens evacuated by three charter flights from China, according to the recommendation of the World Health Organization, were placed in specially trained institutions for medical observation for 14 days (incubation period).
Uzbekistan has placed all those who have been in "China, France, Germany, Iran, Italy, Japan, South Korea and Spain" in a 14 day quarantine, reported on Feb. 28.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 1, the Ministry of Transport of Uzbekistan has officially notified the aviation authorities and companies of the Republic of Korea about the introduction of temporary restrictive measures in air communication between the two countries from 1 March 2020. The number of flights is reduced to 1 flight per week. Arrivals arriving in Uzbekistan from South Korea will be quarantined for 14 days upon arrival.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Ministry of Health in Uzbekistan asked schools and Universities "to refrain from holding international forums, academic competitions" on March 4.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: On March 6, Uzbekistan "postponed the organization of more than 20 official bilateral meetings with Italy."
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: Uzbekistan cancelled all international sporting events due to the coronavirus pandemic
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Uzbekistan "indoor mass events scheduled for March 21 have been cancelled" as well as a"traditional multi-thousand marathon will not take place." March 21 marks the Persian New Year. However, other outdoor Nowruz celebrations will not be cancelled.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description:
"Prime Minister of Uzbekistan also said that the festivities on
Navruz and mass events were canceled due to the coronavirus. All concerts, cultural and sporting events, as well
as festivities are canceled indefinitely." UPDATE: Originally celebrations on March 21 were supposed to be allowed to be held outdoors, now they too are cancelled.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: The "chairman of the Board of Muslims of Uzbekistan, Mufti Usmonkhon Alimov, has issued a fatwa placing a temporary ban on Friday prayers in mosques" on March 16.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 15, Uzbekistan "recommended that religious institutions limit mass events."
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
